oracle.pg.text.solr

Class SolrAutoIndex<T extends Element>

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.pg.text.solr.SolrIndex<T>
      • oracle.pg.text.solr.SolrAutoIndex<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Index<T>, OracleAutoIndex<T>, OracleIndex<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SolrEdgeAutoIndex, SolrVertexAutoIndex

    public abstract class SolrAutoIndex<T extends Element>
extends SolrIndex<T>
implements OracleAutoIndex<T>
    This class extends the functions defined in SolrIndex and implements OracleAutoIndex interface to support automatic text indices using SolrCloud.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this index object. This operation will flush and commit all changes executed over the index and free up its underlying resources.
        Specified by:
        close in interface OracleIndex<T extends Element>
        Overrides:
        close in class SolrIndex<T extends Element>

      • containsIndexedKey

        public boolean containsIndexedKey(String key)
        Verifies if the given key is already indexed using this automatic index.
        Specified by:
        containsIndexedKey in interface OracleAutoIndex<T extends Element>
        Parameters:
        key - the key to validate
        Returns:

      • indexElements

        public final void indexElements()
        Index elements in a property graph with respect to the current indexed keys.
        Specified by:

      • put

        public final void put(String key,
       Object value,
       T element,
       org.apache.solr.client.solrj.impl.CloudSolrServer cloudSolrServer)
        Indexes an element with respect to the specified key and value using the given cloudSolrServer object. Using a cloudSolrServer object helps open/commit/close connections to SolrCloud. The user is responsible of executing commits the cloudSolrServer object so the changes executed by this operation are persisted into the text index.
        Overrides:
        put in class SolrIndex<T extends Element>
        Parameters:
        key - the key to index the element by.
        value - the value to index the element by.
        element - the element to index.
        cloudSolrServer - if not null, use the opened CloudSolrServer connection, this avoids opening/closing a CloudSolrServer connection at flush time.

      • reindexElements

        public void reindexElements()
        Re-index the elements of the associated property graph based on the current indexed keys.
        Specified by:
        reindexElements in interface OracleAutoIndex<T extends Element>

      • reindexElementsPartitioned

        public void reindexElementsPartitioned()
        Re-index the elements of the associated property graph based on the current indexed keys using getElementsPartitioned APIs.
        Specified by:
        reindexElementsPartitioned in interface OracleAutoIndex<T extends Element>
